ErrorIndex.title: Wrapper for index information inside an error.

causeCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIndexedCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.
Each of these errors MUST have index set.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIsInternal.description: If true, then the cause (`causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection`) should be hidden from the user.

causeSimple.description:
Simple string error type.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

code.description:
the numeric HTTP error code for the response.

Deprecated: Prefer to check the request's HTTP response code directly.

details.description:
The optional details of the error response.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeSimple`.

dictionary.description:
Dictionary/map of associated data/information relevant to the error.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted
with information from this dictionary.

Deprecated: Use "values" instead.

domain.description:
The "domain" for the error.  If empty, it is an EDA
core error.  Alternatively it can be an EDA application
"apiVersion" value (e.g. interfaces.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1)
indicating that the error is specific to that application.
The domain gives the receiver information that they can use
to help them interpret the "type" field.

errors.description:
Collection of errors in cases where more than one exists.
This needs to be flexible so we can support multiple formats.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeCollection` or `causeIndexedCollection` instead.

internal.description:
Internal error code number.

Deprecated: "type" & "domain" should be used instead to uniquely identify this error.

message.description: The basic text error message for the error response.

ref.description: Reference to the error source. Should typically be the URI of the request.

type.description:
Type defines a unique identifier for the error, within the domain.
This may be used (along with the domain) to find an internationalization translation for the message.

SHOULD be a valid golang identifier, and SHOULD be in UpperCamelCase.

values.description:
Associated data/information.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted with information from this dictionary.

Note that this map MUST NOT contain JSON objects (`{...}`) or arrays (`[...]`), only simple JSON types are permitted.

ErrorResponse.title: Generic error response for REST APIs.

K8SPatchOp.description: The definition for a JSON patch for a resource, as in RFC 6902

from.description:
Only applies to a "move" operation, and is the path to the field/value within
the target JSON object that should be moved to the location specified by the "path"
field.

op.description: The type of operation this patch should perform.

path.description:
The path to the field within the target JSON object
that should be patched according to the "op" field.

value.description:
This field would be set to the value which the user intends to put in the
field referenced by the "path" field.  The type of the value should match
the type of the field as indicated by the schema of the resource being
patched.

x-permissive.description:
For an "add" operation, an already-present field referenced by the "path" will
result in an error unless this field is true.  Similarly for a non-existent
target field of a "remove" operation.

Status.title: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.

ack.description: acknowledge or reject the input request

input.description: provide a json blob to the workflow

com.nokia.eda.interfaces.v1alpha1.Breako.description: Breakout is the Schema for the breakouts API

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: The apiVersion must be set to interfaces.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1
The kind must be set to Breakout

spec.description: Breakout allows for the configuration of interface breakouts on specified Nodes. This resource specifies the Nodes, parent Interfaces, the number of breakout channels, and the speed of each channel.

channels.description: The number of breakout channels to create.
channels.title: Number of Channels

interface.description: A list of normalized parent interface/port.
interface.title: Normalized Parent Interface

node.description: Reference to a list of TopoNodes where the parent interfaces are to be broken out.
node.title: Nodes

nodeSelector.description: Label selector to select nodes on which to configure the breakout interfaces. Either Nodes or NodeSelector must have at least one value set.
nodeSelector.title: Node Selector

speed.description: The speed of each breakout channel.
speed.title: Speed

spec.title: Specification

status.description: BreakoutStatus defines the observed state of Breakout
status.title: Status

com.nokia.eda.interfaces.v1alpha1.Breako.description: BreakoutList is a list of breakouts

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: A valid name is made up of one or more components where each component is separated by period characters.  Each component must start and end with a lower case alphanumeric character and the body of the component is made up of zero or more lower case alphanumeric and hyphen characters.

com.nokia.eda.interfaces.v1alpha1.CheckI.description: CheckInterfaces is the Schema for the checkinterfacess API

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: The apiVersion must be set to interfaces.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1
The kind must be set to CheckInterfaces

spec.description: CheckInterfacesSpec defines the desired state of CheckInterfaces
spec.title: Specification

status.description: CheckInterfacesStatus defines the observed state of CheckInterfaces
status.title: Status

com.nokia.eda.interfaces.v1alpha1.CheckI.description: CheckInterfacesList is a list of checkinterfacess

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: A valid name is made up of one or more components where each component is separated by period characters.  Each component must start and end with a lower case alphanumeric character and the body of the component is made up of zero or more lower case alphanumeric and hyphen characters.

com.nokia.eda.interfaces.v1alpha1.Interf.description: Interface is the Schema for the interfaces API

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: The apiVersion must be set to interfaces.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1
The kind must be set to Interface

spec.description: Interface allows for the configuration of various interface properties such as enabling/disabling the interface, setting descriptions, specifying interface types (e.g., LAG, interface, loopback), configuring VLAN encapsulation, and setting Ethernet or LAG-specific options.

encapType.description: Enable or disable VLAN tagging on this interface. [default="null"]
encapType.title: Encapsulation Type

crcMonitor.description: Configuration of CRC monitoring on the interface.

enabled.description: Enables CRC monitoring on the interface.
enabled.title: Enabled

signalDegrade.description:
Signal degrade threshold configuration.
eda:ui:title="Signal Degrade"

exponent.description: Threshold exponent for the signal degrade condition.
exponent.title: Threshold Exponent

multiplier.description: Threshold multiplier for the signal degrade condition.
multiplier.title: Threshold Multiplier

signalFailure.description:
Signal failure threshold configuration.
eda:ui:title="Signal Failure"

exponent.description: Threshold exponent for the signal failure condition.
exponent.title: Threshold Exponent

multiplier.description: Threshold multiplier for the signal failure condition.
multiplier.title: Threshold Multiplier

windowSizeSec.description: Sliding window size over which CRC errors are measured, in number of seconds.
windowSizeSec.title: Window Size

crcMonitor.title: CRC Monitor

fec.description: Sets the Forward Error Correction (FEC) on the members of the interface.
fec.title: Forward Error Correction

holdDownTimer.description: The hold-time down behavior is triggered with events that try to bring the ethernet interface down and can change quickly. It is not triggered with an admin-state disable event or interface disable due to other internal reasons.  Units in milliseconds.
holdDownTimer.title: Hold Down Timer

holdUpTimer.description: The hold-time up behavior is triggered with any event that tries to bring up the ethernet interface.  While the hold-time up is running, the transceiver laser will be enabled, however the higher layers will not be notified that the interface is operationally up until the timer expires.  Units in milliseconds.
holdUpTimer.title: Hold Up Timer

loopbackMode.description: Enable dataplane loopback on the interface.
loopbackMode.title: Loopback Mode

reloadDelayTimer.description: After the system boots, the reload-delay timer in seconds keeps an interface shut down with the laser off for a configured amount of time until connectivity with the rest of network is established.
reloadDelayTimer.title: Reload Delay Timer

speed.description: The speed of this interface, in human-readable format - e.g. 25G, 100G.
speed.title: Speed

standbySignaling.description: Indicates the standby-signaling used in the interface.
standbySignaling.title: Standby Signaling

broadcastRate.description: Sets the maximum rate allowed for ingress broadcast frames on the interface.
broadcastRate.title: Broadcast Rate

multicastRate.description: Sets the maximum rate allowed for ingress multicast frames on the interface.
multicastRate.title: Multicast Rate

units.description: Set the units to be used for measurement.
units.title: Units

unknownUnicastRate.description: Sets the maximum rate allowed for ingress unknown unicast frames on the interface.
unknownUnicastRate.title: Unknown Unicast Rate

transparentL2CPProtocols.description: A list of L2CP protocols to tunnel. Options: LLDP, LACP, xSTP, Dot1x, PTP, All.
transparentL2CPProtocols.title: Transparent L2CP Protocols

adminKey.description: Configure the LACP admin-key to be advertised by the local system.
adminKey.title: Admin Key

interval.description: Set the period between LACP messages, uses the lacp-period-type enumeration. [default="fast"]
interval.title: Interval

lacpFallback.description: LACP fallback allows one or more designated links of an LACP controlled LAG to go into forwarding mode if LACP is not yet operational after a configured timeout period. [default=disabled]

timeout.description: Specifies the LACP-fallback timeout interval in seconds. [default=60]
timeout.title: Timeout

lacpFallback.title: Fallback

mode.description: Active is to initiate the transmission of LACP PDUs. Passive is to wait for peer to initiate the transmission of LACP PDUs.[default="active"]
mode.title: Mode

systemIdMac.description: The MAC address portion of the Node's System ID. This is combined with the system priority to construct the 8-octet system-id.
systemIdMac.title: System ID MAC

systemPriority.description: System priority used by the Node on this LAG interface. Lower value is higher priority for determining which Node is the controlling system.[default=32768]
systemPriority.title: System Priority

minLinks.description: The min-link threshold specifies the minimum number of member links that must be active in order for the LAG to be operationally up. If the number of active links falls below this threshold, the entire LAG is brought operationally down.[default=1]
minLinks.title: Minimum Links

esi.description: 10 byte Ethernet Segment Identifier, if not set a type 0 ESI is generated. [default=auto]
esi.title: ESI

mode.description:
"all-active": All interfaces are active.
"single-active": In a single active MH LAG, the active and standby function is handled at the sub-interface layer within a network-instance.  That is, the physical interfaces within the same LAG all remain operationally up, however each sub-interface associated with a network-instance has its operational state up or down based on whether it is selected to be the active or standby sub-interface.
"port-active": When port active MH LAG is enabled, the active and standby function is handled at the interface level.
mode.title: Mode

preferredActiveNode.description: To be used in single-active or port-active modes.  This references the Node object and when set, the DF algorithm is configured to type preference and the selected Node is set with a higher preference value.  All other Nodes have a lower value configured.
preferredActiveNode.title: Preferred Active Node

reloadDelayTimer.description: After the system boots, the reload-delay timer in seconds keeps an interface shut down with the laser off for a configured amount of time until connectivity with the rest of network is established. [default=100]
reloadDelayTimer.title: Reload Delay Timer

revertive.description: To be used in single-active or port-active modes.  When true, if there is a switch of active interface in the LAG and the original interface comes back up, the LAG will switch back to using the original interface as active. [default=false]
revertive.title: Revertive

type.description: This type defines whether whether it is a static or LACP LAG. [default=lacp]
type.title: Type

lldp.description: Enable or disable LLDP on the members of the interface.
lldp.title: Link Layer Discovery Protocol

members.description: List of members on which to apply properties, for single interface this would be a list of 1.

aggregateId.description:
When using a LAG, the aggregateId can be specified per set of interfaces on a node.
LAG interface with which this interface is associated.
aggregateId.title: Aggregate ID

description.description: Description of the member, inherited from the interface if not provided.
description.title: Description

interface.description: Reference to an interface in the normalized format. Ex: SRL ethernet-1/1 would be ethernet-1-1. SROS port 2/1/1 would be ethernet-2-1.
interface.title: Interface

lacpPortPriority.description: Configure the port priority for LACP. This value is used to determine which port should be activated with LACP fallback mode. Lower values are more preferred.[default=32768]
lacpPortPriority.title: LACP Port Priority

members.title: Members

mtu.description: MTU to apply on the interface(s).
mtu.title: MTU

type.description: Type defines whether the interface is a Lag or Interface.
type.title: Type

spec.title: Specification

enabled.description: The administrative status of the Interface.
enabled.title: Enabled

lastChange.description: Indicates when this Interface last changed state.
lastChange.title: Last Change

members.description: List of members in this Interface.

enabled.description: The administrative status of this member.
enabled.title: Enabled

interface.description: The name of the interface in normalized format.
interface.title: Interface

lastChange.description: Indicates when this member last changed state.
lastChange.title: Last Change

neighbors.description: List of discovered neighbors on this member.

interface.description: The name of a neighbor interface of this member in node specific format.
interface.title: Interface

node.description: The name of a neighbor node of this member in node specific format.
node.title: Node

neighbors.title: Neighbors

node.description: The node on which the interface is configured.
node.title: Node

nodeInterface.description: Node specific interface name, for example "ethernet-1/1", "1/1/c1/1".
nodeInterface.title: Node Interface

operationalState.description: Indicates the current operational state of this member.
operationalState.title: Operational State

speed.description: Indicates the operational speed of the member.
speed.title: Speed

members.title: Members

operationalState.description: Indicates the current operational state of the Interface.
operationalState.title: Operational State

speed.description: Indicates the operational speed of the Interface in aggregate.
speed.title: Speed
